intro: Batidophaca villosa, commonly known as the hairy batidophaca, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Batidophaca villosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
